summary: NAR 03/03/2003.  THE CONSUMER HAD PROBLEMS WITH THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION WHICH EVENTUALLY HAD TO BE REPLACED,  ALSO THE BRAKES WORE OUT PREMATURELY DUE TO LACK OF A SECOND GEAR.  THE ENGINE WENT OUT IN NOV 1997 WHICH WAS LIKELY HEAD GASKET FAILURE.  JAN 9, 2003 THE ENGINE OVERHEATED  WHICH WAS DIAGNOSED AS A DEFECTIVE HEAD GASKET IN THE REPLACEMENT ENGINE.  *JB
